document.masterDocTitle: Spongillaflies (Neuroptera: Sisyridae) of North America with a key to the larvae and adults

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Spongillaflies (Neuroptera: Sisyridae) of North America with a key to the larvae and adults

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species is widely distributed in the U.S. and Canada (
Parfin & Gurney 1956
,
Penny et al . 1997
). New distributional records are reported here from Alabama, Arkansas, New Hampshire, New Jersey , Ohio and Vermont in the United States . Given the distribution of
S. vicaria
in southern California, Arizona and Texas, this species likely occurs in northern Mexico as well, but it has not yet been collected there. Adults have been taken in January and April through October. This species is occasionally collected with
C. areolaris
and
S. nigra
where their ranges overlap.

Published and Supplemental State, County and Parish Records.
